brief.brief: To add a new field to the dbdict record, first position the cursor at the structure to contain the new field, and then press F1 (New Field).
If the new field is not part of an existing structure, position the cursor at the field called descriptor and press F1.

detail.detail: Service Manager reads the descriptor field as the structure that contains all fields within the dbdict record.
For example, in the incident dbdict record, if the new field is to be part of the structure called middle, position the cursor at middle and press F1 (New Field).
Note: When adding a new field to an existing structure, the new field is located at the end of that structure's list.
The Add/Edit Field Window opens at the bottom of the screen, displaying its own set of option keys.
Specify the name of the new field into the name: field.
Press F5 (Select Type) to access the list of available data types.
Select the correct data type by placing the cursor at the type and then pressing Enter.
Service Manager automatically transfers it to the type: field.
To complete the add operation, press F1. To abort the add new field command, press F3.
After the field is added, the system acknowledges addition of the new field
